The presence of fur and whiskers on the animal, as well as its size and shape, are all indicators that the animal is a cat and not a reptile.

Reptiles have dry, scaly skin, while cats have soft fur. Reptiles have a three-chambered heart, while cats have four-chambered hearts. Reptiles lay eggs, while cats give birth to live young. Reptiles have a cold-blooded metabolism, while cats are warm-blooded.
